features: Be dialed in all the time, everywhere and anywhere with the Acer Chromebook 315. Recognized as the perfect multi-media companion, this special machine is super thin, extra light, and delivers unmatched value in todays fast-paced, technology-driven world. It features a 15.6" Full HD Touch IPS Display, an impressive HDR camera, fast wireless connectivity, and long-lasting battery life, so you can run your favorite Google apps or access your photos, videos, music, and documents all day long.
15.6" Full HD (1920 x 1080) Widescreen IPS LED-backlit Multi-Touch Display;
Intel Celeron N4020 Dual-Core Processor 1.1 GHz, Up to 2.8GHz; 4GB LPDDR4 RAM; 64GB eMMC Flash Memory; No Optical Drive
2 - USB Type-C ports USB 3.1 Gen 1 (up to 5 Gbps) DisplayPort over USB Type-C 2 - USB 3.0 Ports; 1 x Headphone output/Microphone input combo . Bluetooth4.0, 802.11ac, HD Webcam
Google Classroom Compatible! Chrome OS, Only 2.76 lb, 12.5 hours battery life. Color: Silver
body.description: Google Chrome OS 15.6" Full HD (1920 x 1080) Widescreen IPS LED-backlit Multi-Touch Display. Intel Celeron Processor N4020 1.10GHz (2 Core, 2M Cache, up to 2.8GHz) 4GB system memory for basic multitasking 64GB eMMC flash memory Built-in cloud support Intel HD Graphics 400 Bluetooth 4.2 interface syncs with compatible devices 2 - USB Type-C ports USB 3.1 Gen 1 (up to 5 Gbps) DisplayPort over USB Type-C 2 - USB 3.0 Ports Next-Gen Intel Wireless-AC connectivity: Connect to a Wireless-AC router for nearly 3x the speed, more capacity and wider coverage than Wireless-N. Backward-compatible with all other Wi-Fi networks and hotspots. Built-in HD webcam with microphone Built-in virus protection and Google products Headphone output. Note: This Chromebook does not include a built-in DVD/CD drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding value - better than more expensive laptops
reviews.reviewText: This is my wife's 'daily driver' laptop outside of work. As you might expect, its main functions are web-based. That is, what many of us are doing now and this laptop excels at this.Pros:Long batter life - this machine has a much longer battery life than my macbook air.Decent Screen - large touchscreen that lets you pinch-and-zoom, scroll, etcGood build quality - It is plastic, but after almost 8 months no incidentsPlenty of horsepower for most tasks - no hiccups on web-videos, email, web surfing, and light computing tasksPrice - this thing is a great deal.Cons:While the keyboard is decent, it does not have a backlit keyboardThat's about it for the cons! If you are looking to do video editing or cutting edge gaming, this is not the machine for you. However, if you are looking for a laptop with a decently sized screen and long battery life to do emails, word processing, and web-surfing, this is a great choice to do it economically.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Sent in for "repairs" right after receiving it.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this item brand new and it wouldn't connect to the internet except as a guest. I had to wait until the next morning for tech support to arrive to work. They walked me through steps to try to reset it back to factory specs (???) which it got stuck at about the third step. She told me they would send me labels for FedEx to pick it up, I told her I didn't have a printer, she said FedEx would have the QR label. After two more phone calls, I found out I have to jump through hoops, find a FedEx onsite place, after waiting a day for the QR label to hit my e-mail, take it to an onsite location where they can use my email to print out the label and send the computer in for repairs. Due to my health problems, none of this can happen. I have to send my phone with someone else, to the next town over to the nearest FedEx onsite location, with my "NEW" CHROMEBOOK, to ship it back, wait for them to receive, fix it, return it to me, and hope it works.I have had two Chromebooks in the past and loved them both. Unfortunately, I will never trust this machine now, and I will never buy another Chromebook. Lost a lifelong customer over this one. What happened to "We'll send you a new one?" If you send out a faulty item, you don't ask the customer to jump through hoops so you can make repairs and send the same crappy item back to the customer! You send them one that works in the first place!!Update: I received my Chromebook on 11/29 (my sister received hers the same day, same problem). I was able to get it shipped out on the 12/5 via FedEx using Acer's QR label in my Gmail. It was supposed to be delivered on 12/8 but got hung up and wasn't returned to them until 12/11. I received at email saying it was received and would take 7-10 BUSINESS days for a certified technician to look at the machine. This is the worst customer service I have ever seen. Buyer Beware!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Good for the Price
reviews.reviewText: I bought this just to tide me over because my MacBook Pro’s keyboard broke. I bought a Chromebook about 5 years ago and they have definitely improved. This Chromebook is very good. Scrolling can sometimes be choppy. The screen is very good. Images are crisp. I don’t do formal testing but I did put it side by side against the HP Omen gaming laptop I bought a year before and they are quite comparable when watching HD videos from YouTube. It starts up quite fast which is expected. I used Microsoft 365 while I had this laptop and it’s probably the only negative for me. I’d rather have it installed.I am very happy with this product but I gave it to my father so he can have a new laptop. I bought another one that is more expensive (a proper laptop) and I’m more satisfied with this Chromebook. No issues here except: I don’t like that they say it’s 2022 when it’s manufactured in 2018 and the updates only last until 2027. Don’t get me wrong. I’d still have bought it because I don’t plan to use it past 2027 anyway.I may buy the 17” version of this Chromebook just to have it for watching videos and browsing. It’s not that much more compared to this version although the 17” one is not touchscreen.
